title: Captain Sydney Jary, soldier who was awarded an MC in Germany and wrote a bestselling book about his experiences – obituary
text:
Captain Sydney Jary, who has died aged 95, won an MC in Germany in 1944 and subsequently wrote an account of his experiences which became a bestseller.

In 1944 Jary was serving as a platoon commander with the 4th Bn The Somerset Light Infantry (4 SLI). On the night of November 2 he was leading a five-man recce patrol at Knapheide, a small village close to the Reichswald Forest.

Up to that time, enemy action had foiled all attempts to penetrate an area on the battalion front. Jary and his men succeeded in infiltrating this area and pinpointed six enemy machine-gun positions by drawing their fire.
